content.description: Very thin to a physical topout.
content.location: Start on the side opposite the ocean.

content.description:
Straightforward beta beyond the undercling crouch start. Progresses to tension-y presses, wide pulls, and comfy feet. Finishes up-right of the undercling start. 

 The finish requires a pull on a big, sharp feature that has a visible crack. Kick-tested and seemingly solid, the hold shouldn't blow.
content.protection: n/a; 2-3 pads ideally, good ankles for the confident bunch.
content.location: Start is far right on the face with the low sand-tunnel; undercling between/left of the main light-angle overhang and the waist-high boulder wedged under the chief rock.

content.description: Obvious match start at ledge about 5' up. Follow crimps to top out. Avoid side edges, because that's cheating (;
content.location: Across from main boulder, North-side (do not sort route location on MP).

content.description: Sit start to a short powerful top out.
content.location: North side of bolder. Same boulder as other two problems.

content.description: Can get pretty windy. Very secluded and loud with the ocean. There are two notable boulders with a fair bit of potential for more projects stretching from sharp crimpy traverses to juggy vertical shoots & ugly sit starts with fat slabby moves to reachy throws and finicky feet.
